snippet: A federal judge commuted the sentence of Joseph C. Massino, a former Bonanno crime family leader who broke the code of silence, and he will be released from federal custody in 60 days.
abstract: Federal judge commutes two consecutive life sentences of Joseph C Massino, former Bonanno crime family leader who became first official boss of one of New York's five crime families to break code of silence; prosecutors sought reduction of sentence after Massino provided investigators with information of hundreds of people associated with crime families across New York.
lead_paragraph: A federal judge commuted the sentence of Joseph C. Massino, a former Bonanno crime family leader who broke the code of silence, and he will be released from federal custody in 60 days.

headline.main: Serving Two Life Terms, Mob Boss Who Became Informer Wins Release
headline.print_headline: Serving Two Life Terms, Mob Boss Who Became Informer Wins Release
